column4: Can anyone help me? I'm dropping in BusyBox instead of loading the Live CD?
did you run "check the cd for defects" from the CD's boot menu?
I dont get in the CD's boot menu. I'm using grub to boot the image from a hard drive.
you need to mention that you are not just booting straight from the cd...
I am
I am (mentioning it)
/usr/share/gnome/default.session doesn't exist now though
bash
you want bash
when I try to run bash, nothing happens
bash is your default shell anyway
then it doesnt work. I cant have more than one line.
you need to pastebin what you are referring to.  "Can't have more than one line?"
Suppose I want to declare a variable, then do something with it. I cant do that in bash
why not?  How are you trying?
I tried suppose: plik=~/w <enter> echo plik <enter> but plik isnt defined anymore
you need to export variables
humm, I must be mistaken, using a simpler example seemed to work
if you want variables you define to stay defined in child processes you do "export foo=bar"
the kernel is the same isnt it?
no
apt-cache show linux-image-server
/join #bash
maybe with expect
